x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Communities living near rivers are often at high risk during heavy rains or flood seasons. Many residents do not receive timely information about rising water levels or flood warnings, leading to loss of property, displacement, and even loss of life. Traditional communication methods, such as radio announcements or manual alerts are often delayed, unreliable, or inaccessible to people in remote or low-connectivity areas. There is a clear need for a centralized, automated, and easily accessible digital platform to monitor water levels and promptly alert residents and authorities.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow App Engine Studio– for workflows and automation.
IntegrationHub – to connect with weather APIs or IoT sensor systems.
Service Portal/UI Builder – for user-friendly dashboards and maps.
Flow Designer – to automate alert workflows.
Notification Engine – for multi-channel alert delivery (SMS, email, push).

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

All OutoftheBox 

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Real time Data Collection & User Awareness (hence we should give these alerts in local languages and conduct campaigns)
